meanings.definition: The state or quality of being capable of germinating.
meanings.sent1: The germiness of the soil allowed the seeds to sprout quickly.
meanings.sent2: The farmer ensured the germiness of the seeds by providing adequate water and sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The germiness of the garden soil was so good that even the rocks seemed to sprout tiny plants.
meanings.sent4: The germiness of her ideas sparked creativity in the team.
meanings.sent5: The germiness of the compost pile was evident in the lush growth of the plants nearby.

meanings.definition: The condition of being conducive to germination.
meanings.sent1: The germiness of the environment was perfect for the seeds to grow.
meanings.sent2: The gardener carefully maintained the germiness of the greenhouse for optimal plant growth.
meanings.sent3: The germiness of the atmosphere in the greenhouse made the plants dance with joy.
meanings.sent4: The germiness of the team's collaboration led to great success.
meanings.sent5: The germiness of the rain-soaked soil was a sight to behold as tiny sprouts emerged.
